  • Constructor Details

    • ApplicationClient

      public ApplicationClient​(java.lang.String hostname, int port)
      ApplicationClient Constructor: defines the hostname and the port for the client socket
      Parameters:
      hostname - server hostname
      port - server port

  • Method Details

    • getNextCommand

      public Command getNextCommand()
      Takes the file containing the list of commands, and loads it into a variable of type Command which is returned
      Returns:
      the Command read in the next file line, else returns null

    • initialise

      public void initialise​(java.lang.String commandFile, java.lang.String outputFile)
      Opens command and output files
      Parameters:
      commandFile - command file path
      outputFile - output file path

    • treatCommand

      public java.lang.Object treatCommand​(Command command)
      Takes a Command, and execute it on the server. The result of the execution is returned. If the command does not return a result, we return null. Each call must open a connection, execute, and close the connection.
      Parameters:
      command - takes the Command read in the file
      Returns:
      the result of the executed Command, else returns null

    • scenario

      public void scenario()
      It contains the sequence of steps to be performed for the test. It will make successive calls to getNextCommand() and treatCommand(Command command).

    • commandFromPrompt

      public void commandFromPrompt()
      Allows user to enter commands from prompt after file treatment

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main program Take 4 args: 1. Server hostname 2. Server port 3. Command file path 4. Output file path This method create an instance of the ApplicationClient class, initialize it, then apply the scenario
      Parameters:
      args - arguments of the main program

    • printCorrectUsageAndExit

      public static void printCorrectUsageAndExit()
      Prints correct program arguments usage
